Inflammatory bowel disease_1:
Patient Description 1:
    A 33-year-old female patient with a history of recurrent abdominal pain, rated at 6/10 in intensity, accompanied by persistent diarrhoea, averaging 4 loose stools per day, and intermittent episodes of bloody diarrhoea. The patient reported unintentional weight loss of 10 pounds over the past three months despite a consistent appetite. She also described a pattern of clinical relapse and remission, with alternating periods of heightened symptoms and temporary improvements. There is no history of recent travel or dietary changes. The patient's medical history is unremarkable, with no prior diagnosis of gastrointestinal disorders.
Inflammatory bowel disease_2:
Patient Description 2:
    A 45-year-old male patient presented with chronic abdominal pain, which he described as a constant dull ache, rated at 5/10 in severity, localized in the lower left quadrant, and frequently associated with diarrhoea, averaging 6 loose stools per day. The patient reported notable weight loss of 15 pounds over the last four months, despite maintaining his regular dietary habits. He has also experienced episodes of rectal bleeding during bowel movements. The symptoms have shown a fluctuating pattern, with periods of clinical relapse and remission. The patient has no significant medical history or recent travel.
Inflammatory bowel disease_3:
Patient Description 3:
    A 28-year-old male patient with a six-month history of abdominal pain, intermittently cramping and sharp, with pain scores ranging from 4 to 7 out of 10 in intensity. The pain is associated with recurrent diarrhoea, averaging 5 loose stools per day, and episodes of bloody diarrhoea. The patient reported an unintentional weight loss of 12 pounds despite maintaining a regular diet. He described periods of clinical relapse and remission, with no identifiable triggers. The patient has no previous history of gastrointestinal issues or relevant travel history.
